name: Springer Mountain
description: Southern Terminus. The official start, with a plaque and register.

name: Blood Mountain
description: Georgia's highest A.T. point (4,458 ft) with a historic CCC stone shelter and panoramic views.

name: Neels Gap
description: Mountain Crossings outfitter (the only building the trail passes through) for early resupply.

name: Fontana Dam
description: Tallest dam east of the Rockies. Entering the Smokies.

name: Clingmans Dome
description: Highest point on the entire A.T. (6,643 ft) with an observation tower.

name: Charlie's Bunion
description: Dramatic rocky outcrop with stunning views.

name: Max Patch
description: Iconic open bald with sweeping mountain views.

name: Hot Springs
description: Trail runs through downtown. Natural mineral baths and resupply. One of three towns the A.T. passes directly through.

name: Roan Highlands
description: Grassy balds (Round Bald, Jane Bald, Grassy Ridge) with 360-degree vistas.

name: Damascus
description: "Trail Town USA." One of three towns the A.T. passes through downtown. Hosts Trail Days each May.

name: Grayson Highlands
description: Wild ponies, open balds, and Mount Rogers (highest in VA).

name: McAfee Knob
description: The most photographed spot on the A.T., with a dramatic cliff ledge overlook.

name: Dragon's Tooth
description: Rugged rock formations and views (part of the Virginia Triple Crown).

name: Tinker Cliffs
description: Rugged rock formations and views (part of the Virginia Triple Crown).

name: Harpers Ferry
description: Psychological halfway point (~1,014 miles) and ATC headquarters.

name: Pine Grove Furnace
description: Official halfway marker (varies slightly yearly).

name: Delaware Water Gap
description: Historic crossing at the PA/NJ border. A.T. Community with scenic notch cut by the Delaware River.

name: Bear Mountain Bridge
description: Lowest elevation on the trail (124 ft) crossing the Hudson River.

name: Mount Greylock
description: Massachusetts' highest point (3,491 ft) with a war memorial tower and views of five states.

name: Hanover
description: Trail runs through Main Street. One of three towns the A.T. passes through. Dartmouth Outing Club maintains the section.

name: Mount Moosilauke
description: White Mountains begin - first big alpine climb for NOBOs.

name: Franconia Ridge
description: One of the longest above-treeline stretches on the A.T. Mt. Lafayette, Lincoln, Liberty. Stunning 360-degree views.

name: Mount Washington
description: Highest in the Northeast outside Maine; Presidential Range with exposed ridges.

name: Mahoosuc Notch
description: "The hardest mile" with boulder scrambling.

name: 100 Mile Wilderness
description: Most remote section (~92 miles) from Monson to Abol Bridge. No road crossings, requires 10+ days of supplies.

name: Gulf Hagas
description: "Grand Canyon of Maine" - dramatic slate gorge with 130-ft walls and waterfalls in the 100 Mile Wilderness.

name: Abol Bridge
description: End of the 100 Mile Wilderness. First view of Katahdin for NOBOs before the final approach.

name: Mount Katahdin
description: Northern Terminus. The iconic wooden sign marking the end, with a challenging boulder climb.
